message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Using data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys and Demographic and Health Surveys, we investigate the relationship between labor productivity and employee health.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys", "Demographic and Health Surveys"], "topic": ["Health", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze a comprehensive dataset on the Indian mining sector which includes information on mine-specific characteristics, mineral production, and companies' financial performance to assess the impact of environmental regulations on profitability.", "dataset": ["dataset on the Indian mining sector"], "topic": ["Extractive Industries", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "This study leverages household survey data from multiple low-income countries including Nepal, Uganda, and Rwanda to assess the effectiveness of cash transfer programs in improving child nutrition outcomes.", "dataset": ["household survey data from Nepal", "household survey data from Uganda", "household survey data from Rwanda"], "topic": ["Nutrition", "Social Protection"]}, {"sentence": "We explore patterns of climate-related disasters using a dataset on extreme weather events covering regions across the globe.", "dataset": ["dataset on extreme weather events"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the Mexican National Survey of Occupation and Employment, we evaluate the impact of skill upgrading programs on informal sector workers and their earnings.", "dataset": ["Mexican National Survey of Occupation and Employment"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "In this article, we compare measures of poverty obtained from consumption expenditure and income data using evidence from the Living Standards Measurement Study surveys conducted in Bangladesh and India.", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measurement Study surveys conducted in Bangladesh", "Living Standards Measurement Study surveys conducted in India"], "topic": ["Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "Our analysis relies on three sources of data: annual reports published by the country's financial regulator, market prices from Thomson Reuters Eikon, and company-level data from the Rwanda Development Board.", "dataset": ["annual reports published by the country's financial regulator", "market prices from Thomson Reuters Eikon", "company-level data from the Rwanda Development Board"], "topic": ["Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "We use a combination of household survey data and satellite images to investigate the relationship between land tenure security and agricultural productivity in rural Ethiopia.", "dataset": ["household survey data", "satellite images"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the World Bank Logistics Performance Index and Doing Business report, we assess the impact of infrastructure investment on trade competitiveness in low-income countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank Logistics Performance Index", "Doing Business report"], "topic": ["Infrastructure", "Competitiveness", "Trade"]}, {"sentence": "Our analysis is based on two datasets: individual-level surveys of refugees and migrants from Syria, Iraq, and Afghanistan currently residing in Europe, and administrative data on European labour markets.", "dataset": ["individual-level surveys of refugees and migrants from Syria", "Iraq", "and Afghanistan currently residing in Europe", "administrative data on European labour markets"], "topic": ["Migration", "Jobs & Development"]}]
